name: position and status in groups and organizations

children.name: a position in society or an organization
office
children.definition: a position of authority and responsibility in a government or other organization : chức vụ
examples: the office of vice-president
As chairman of the association, heheldoffice for over twenty years.
The Socialist party have beeninoffice (= governing) /out ofoffice (= not governing) for almost ten years.
She's held various offices during her time as a minister.

children.name: position
children.definition: your job in an organization, company, or profession - use this to talk about how important sb is and how much responsibility they have: vị trí
examples: Her position in the company means that she is responsible for major financial decisions.
He eventually became Lord Chancellor, the most powerful position in the British legal system.
the position of sb
the position of women in society
position of power/ authority/ influence etc
Many of his supporters used their positions of power for personal advantage.
As a priest, he was in aposition of trust.
hold a positionhave a position
Thorn holds one of the most senior positions in the Federal Bank.

children.name: level
children.definition: all the jobs in an organization that are similar in importance and that pay similar amounts of money: vị trí, cấp bậc
examples: The company provides training for staff at all levels.
There are not many part-time workers in the middle and higher levels of management.

children.name: rank
children.definition: sb’s position in an organization such as the army or police force: cấp bậc
examples: Gang members wear clothes or decorations that show the member’s rank.
rank of
He joined the Los Angeles police department and was eventually promoted to the rank of lieutenant.
Four of the boys in Boy Scout Troop 611 reached the rank of Eagle Scout.
hold a rankhave a rank
The position of Secretary of State holds Cabinet rank.

children.name: seat
children.definition: a position as an elected member of a government, or as a member of a group that makes official decisions : ghế chân vị trí
examples: She has a seatonthe board of directors.
He is expected tolosehis seatonthe council in next month's elections.
Shewonher seatinParliament in 1979.
He has a verysafeseat (= a position that is very unlikely to be lost in an election) .
a seat in/on
a seat in the National Assembly
Promotion would mean a seat on the board of directors.
a Parliamentary/ Senate etc seat
the Senate seat for Colorado
win/ gain/ lose a seat(= at an election )
He predicts that his party will gain at least 12 seats.
hold a seat(= have a seat )
The Republicans hold 235 seats and the Democrats have 197.
keep/ hold onto a seat
Mr Adams is expected to keep his seat.
Labour held onto the seat with a 7% majority.

children.name: status
children.definition: sb’s position within an organization or within society, based on how important they are considered to be: địa vị
examples: The tribe buried their dead with ornaments or tools that showed the dead person’s status.
low/ high status
In the Middle Ages, priests and other religious figures had a very high status.
gain/ lose status: nắm giữ/ mất địa vị
She gained celebrity status with her publication of ‘Mastering the Art of French Cooking.’

children.name: standing
children.definition: sb’s position within society or a particular area of activity, based on the respect and admiration that other people have for them : địa vị
examples: Stefano’s standing as an artist has improved over the past few years.
Graduates from certain colleges have a lower standing in the eyes of employers.
a man of standing and wealth.

children.name: hierarchy
children.definition: a system in which people have different positions in an organization, society etc, based on their level of importance: thứ bậc, cấp bậc, tôn ti
examples: Genotti was thought to be number two in the Sicilian Mafia hierarchy.
The school district reorganized the administrative hierarchy, which helped to save money.

children.name: sb who has a high position
senior
children.definition: a senior manager, official etc is one who has an important position in an organization or company: cao cấp
examples: He’s a senior executive at Volkswagen.
a job in senior management
one of the country’s most senior judges

children.name: top
children.partOfSpeech: [sb who has one of the most powerful jobs in business, or one of the most important jobs in a profession]
children.definition: manager /lawyer/ executive etc cấp cao, tốp đầu
examples: The President met with top Korean businessmen.
a top fashion designer

children.name: high-ranking
children.definition: / top ranking
examples: a high-ranking officer/ official/ member etc[sb who has a high position in an organization like the police or army, or in a government department, but not in business] cấp cao
A high-ranking State Department official was accused of selling secret information.
a high-ranking officer in the air force

children.name: head
children.partOfSpeech: [the most important waiter etc, who is in charge of the others]
children.definition: waiter/chef/coach etc trưởng
examples: Don Shula became the youngest head coach in NFL history.
The head counsellor commented that substance abuse was pervasive at the school.

children.name: in a lower position than sb else
junior
children.definition: a junior doctor, officer etc does not have as much power or responsibility as other doctors, officers etc, especially because he or she has not been in the job for very long: cấp thấp
examples: She started work as a junior reporter on a local newspaper.
The most junior officers wore a red stripe on their sleeves
I object to being told what to do by someone junior to me.

children.name: assistant
children.partOfSpeech: [sb whose job is just below the position of a manager, editor etc]
children.definition: manager/ editor/ principal etc phó, phụ
examples: My mother is assistant principal at a school in Washington, D.C.
Noll, an assistant coach with the Colts, was hired by the Steelers as head coach.
assistant[C noun] phụ tá
Hughes, who was Mott’s assistant, will now become head coach.

children.name: subordinate
children.definition: sb who has a lower position and less authority than sb else in an organization: người cấp dưới
examples: Costello will have five direct subordinates.
The idea of being evaluated by subordinates makes some managers uneasy.

children.name: under
children.definition: if people are under sb in authority, they work for that person and have a lower position: dưới quyền
examples: She has at least 40 people under her at Shell.
Several of the employees under him complained of his bullying behavior.

children.name: report to
children.definition: to have someone as your manager:
examples: McKellon will report to Alan Selles, the company’s chairman.
Alan has five members of the production team reporting to him.

children.name: in a high position in an organization
high up
children.definition: to be in a high position in an organization or company:
examples: He works for NASA, fairly high up.
high up in
Her father’s quite high up in the company.
The reporter’s sources were apparently high up in the government.

children.name: be at the top
children.definition: to have the highest position in an organization, company: đứng đầu
examples: Women at the top often have to work harder than men.
be at the top of
The prizes will be awarded to 600 students who graduate at the top of their class.

children.name: in a higher position than sb else
above
children.definition: in a higher position than sb else in an organization or company: ở trên
examples: It’s not the staff that are the problem. It’s the people above them.
The next person above him is the sales manager.

children.name: be senior to
children.definition: to be in a higher position than sb else in an organization or company: là cấp trên của
examples: Technically I’m senior to Smith, but we do more or less the same job.
The men said they had no problems taking orders from women senior to them in rank.

children.name: superior
children.definition: your superior in the organization you work for is the person who has a higher rank than you: cấp trên
examples: He failed to follow a direct order from his superior.
Women who have been harassed by male superiors often don’t complain because they are afraid of losing their jobs.
I will pass your complaint on to my superiors.

children.name: outrank
children.definition: /rank  to be in a higher position in an organization, especially the army:hơn cấp
examples: Successful sales staff will outrank less successful workers, regardless of qualifications.
Because Barnett ranks him, they have to be discreet about their romance.

children.name: in a low position in an organization
low down
children.definition: to be in a low position in an organization, company, or list:thuộc cấp dưới
examples: He doesn’t have any authority over you, he’s fairly low down.
low down in: thuộc cấp dưới trong
At that time I was still fairly low down in the company.

children.name: low-ranking
children.definition: having a low position in an organization: cấp dưới
examples: The scandal involved a number of low-ranking officials in the government.
None of the low-ranking members were allowed to vote at the society’s meeting.

children.name: be at the bottom
children.definition: to be in the lowest position in an organization, company : ở vị trí thấp nhất
examples: Richard started out at the bottom of the firm and worked his way to the top.
You will start at the bottom of the pay scale, but you can expect a raise after 12 months.

children.name: be at the bottom of the pile U
children.definition: be at the bottom of the pile informal if a person is at the bottom of the pile, they are in the lowest position in society, are badly treated, are given the worst jobs etc:ở dưới đáy xã hội
examples: Immigrants have always been at the bottom of the pile for housing.
At the bottom of the pile are the runners, young boys who carry messages all day.

children.name: in the same position in another organization
counterpart
children.definition: người tương nhiệm
examples: Belgian government officials are discussing the matter with their counterparts in France.
Eighteenth-century urban dwellers lived in much worse conditions than their modern counterparts.
The Prime Minister is to meet his Europeancounterparts to discuss the war against drugs.

children.name: opposite number
children.definition: sb who has the same job as sb else in a different organization:người tương nhiệm
examples: The project was run jointly by Morris and his opposite number in the New York office.
After years of communication by telephone she finally met her opposite number in the Spanish government.

children.name: founder
children.definition: sb who establishes an organization : người thành lập; người sáng lập
examples: She is the founder and managing director of the company.
